projects.title: Neorush
projects.subtitle: Multiplayer Motorcycle Game (Tron remake)
description: *Neorush* is a local multiplayer motorcycle combat game (up to 4 players) where players must trap others using their light trails. This game is a 3D remake of the Tron arcade game. Players can compete against each other and against computer-controlled bikes.

During this project, I primarily worked on the AI for the opponent bikes. I used Unreal's AI framework with behavior trees and the EQS (Environment Query System) to give the AI interesting behavior. They play defensively by avoiding trails on the field but become aggressive toward other players when the opportunity arises. I also helped design the UI, and implemented the endgame screen.

projects.title: XSpin
projects.subtitle: Multiplayer spinning tops battle game
description: *XSpin* is a multiplayer spinning tops combat game, where the players (2 to 4) fight on dynamic arenas, using their special capacities.

I implemented the dynamic elements of the arenas : the bumpers and bats from the flipper map, as well as the canons on the pirate map (using Unreal's AI framework). I implemented the dynamic camera following the players, worked on the UI elements and the map's cinematics. I also made some 3D models (bumpers and flipper bats), as well as some VFX (smoke from the canons and wind on the pirate arena).

projects.title: Lift to Heaven
projects.subtitle: Code game jam 2025 - 1st place
description: In *Lift to Heaven*, the player must keep the music of the elevator playing by finding and pushing the right button. They have to find them in boxes, under hats or rugs in order to increase the volume of the music, and go as high as possible.
I implemented the gameplay mechanics, as well as the menus.
This game was made for the 2025 Code Game Jam of Montpellier's IUT school. The theme was "Mélodie à l'infini" (melody to infinity). It won the **1st place**, out of 68 teams.

projects.title: Bowling Builder
projects.subtitle: Strategic bowling game in Virtual Reality
description: *Bowling Builder* is a strategic bowling game in virtual reality, where the player can place blocs to deflect the ball's trajectory. They can also influence the ball when it is thrown by tilting their head. There are 3 levels with different obstacles (like trenches, walls), as well as a tutorial.

I worked on the 'bowling part' of the project : throwing the ball, hitting the pins, starting from a launch zone, managing the score and the reset zones. I also designed and implemented the tutorial and the first level, along with adding audio, visual and haptic feedbacks.

projects.title: Melty
projects.subtitle: Wonderjam 2025
description: The player is an ice cube who wants to reach the boat at the beach before melting completely. The map is divided in several zones woth different temperatures, and the player must collect snowflakes to slow its melting.
I implemented the collectible/quest system, and UI elements.
This game was made during the Wonderjam organized by AEMI-UQAC sponsored by Unisoft-Saguenay. The theme was 'frontiers' and we were attributed 3 sub-themes : 'collector', 'rogue-lite' and 'quest'.

projects.title: Squicky
projects.subtitle: Serious game about forest protection
description: *Squicky* is an educational game designed to raise awareness about the right actions to take in the forest. It was created as part of a serious games course at UQAC. The player takes on the role of a squirrel who must protect their forest by picking up trash, extinguishing campfires, and moving tents placed in protected areas.
I was responsible for the level design as well as the interaction system and the trash collection mechanic.
The game is playable in a web browser.

projects.title: Atubu
projects.subtitle: Mobile app : water tracker
description: *Atubu* is a mobile app allowing you to track your water consumption, thanks to a plant reflecting your current hydration level. Its features include : registering the water quantity you drink every day, adding custom water glasses, consulting your garden (calendar), receiving notifications, adding a widget to your home page.
I particularly worked on the main page, implementing the gauge and plant state, along with the custom glasses, the unit changes (oz/mL), and a part of the garden page.

projects.title: Frogy Frog
projects.subtitle: A plateformer game
description: In this single-player game, the user controls a small frog which has to escape the kitchen using its tongue as a grappling hook.
I worked on the grappling hook mechanism, along with the movements of the frog, and setting the animations from the asset pack.

projects.title: Shroomboom
projects.subtitle: Remaking of the bomberman game
description: This project is a redesigning of the famous bomberman game. It is a 2-4 players competitive game, where the players (mushrooms here) have to eliminate the others by droping bombs. There are 2 types of bonuses it this version.
I worked on the movements of the players, on the UI elements and on the designs of the game.

projects.title: Sign language recognition
projects.subtitle: Machine learning app
description: An application to learn the american sign language alphabet, as part of a machine learning course. We worked with a dataset of images from Kaggle, extracted their characteristics and trained a random forest classifier.
I worked on the user interface, as well as including the model to the project.

projects.title: Medical data integration system
projects.subtitle: Project for the data masses course
description: This project is an interactive graphical interface designed to help users identify potential diseases based on reported symptoms or side effects. The interface queries various data sources, such as medical databases, indexed files and text documents, based on the entries of the user.

One of the challenges of this project was analyzing the extensive data provided, originating from five different sources, to identify the relevant information and establish meaningful connections between them.

projects.title: Real time body landmarks detection with mediapipe
projects.subtitle: Interdisciplinary Research Discovery Project
description: We worked on the early phases of a project with a research laboratory. This project is a serious game for physical reactivation aimed at elderly individuals. The goal was to detect body angles with a webcam, as accurately as possible with a minimalist installation. We conducted a state-of-the-art review of the libraries in use and tested various methods to evaluate their effectiveness.

projects.title: Direct Dealing
projects.subtitle: An app for lending and borrowing material
description: DirectDealing is a circular economy application that allows people to lend/borrow equipment (lawnmower, jackhammer, vegetable peeler, etc.) and/or offer/request services (fixing a water leak, piano lessons, moving assistance, etc.).
It was done in 5 days, during a coding week challenge organized by Telecom Nancy.

projects.title: Le bonheur est dans le potager
projects.subtitle: Web application for managing community gardens
description: *Le bonheur est dans le potager* is a web application that allows connected users to join a community garden, to own a parcell and to add plants in it. An algorithm gives advices on which plants go well together, and suggests adequate placement in the parcell.
